text: Battle Ram
Some Halfling leaders choose to ride to battle in their trusty battle rams. Only the fluffiest rams will do.
Giant Swan
These large birds make ideal mounts for transporting troops around the battlefield quickly. They are also very aggressive and kill with their powerful wings.
Giant Swan
These large birds make ideal mounts for transporting troops around the battlefield quickly. They are also very aggressive and kill with their powerful wings.
Giant Swan
These large birds make ideal mounts for transporting troops around the battlefield quickly. They are also very aggressive and kill with their powerful wings.
Gifted Halflings who have defended the Moot and all within are presented a magical staff from the creatures of Altern Forest.
Dried and treated Tobacco from the Greenleaf plantations are woven into impossible robes showcasing various runes of protection.
My pies are second to none, my proof you ask, well look at my troops, not one can even run!
They said my love of the Halfing's weed would dull my senses but who can resist a puff of Greenleaves finest!
Altern Gnarl Staff
Greenleaf Battle Robes
Butcher
Tobacconist
Halfling Noble
Halflings of the upper echelons of society are friendly and industrious and just like all halflings are perceived as weak but they use this misconception to their advantage.
Entry into the Haffenlyver
Kept by the Elder of the Moot,  the great book Haffenlyver lists the great heroes and notable halfling families. To be entered onto its pages is an honour like no other.
Magic does not come easily to the Halflings and most are only ever able to perform cheap parlor tricks, this does keep the rabble amused though.
Conjuror of Cheap Tricks
Friends to Nature
The Halflings have long had an affinity with nature and both have come to each other's aid in times of need.
Art of Soup
There is an art to making soup a deadly weapon the viscosity, temperature and so on has to be carefully considered and when done right no-one, however mighty, will be laughing.
Even Darkness Must Pass
There’s some good in this world and it’s worth fighting for!
A New Home
They came in search of food but what they found was home.
You're Part Of This World!
Our friends are out there. They need our help! They cannot fight this war on their own.
Masters of Broth
The closer we are to danger, the farther we are from harm.
Cook
Despite not being a Master Chef, a Cook as a leader is always seen as a good sign for a Halfling army.
Charlatan
This one is pretending to be more than he really is and he's quite good at it.
Glutton
Ogres respect Halflings - they have quite the gut for their small size. And this Halfling has an even bigger gut than most others.
Farmer
A healthy and stable homegrown diet is the base of every Halfling society - and their armies.
Warden
Wardens are the professional warriors of the Moot. They are highly respected by other Halflings.
Borrower
This ring is so shiny and pretty - my precious! But then again, this necklace is also quite nice looking....
Adventurer
Most Halflings prefer a comfortable, safe life at home. Some however are drawn to foreign lands with a compulsion to explore.
Penny-pincher
The cheapest supplies, who cares if the food doesn't taste that good as long as it fills the soldier's stomachs? Well, the soldiers certainly do...
For the Moot!
“There's power in stories. That's all history is: the best tales. The ones that last. Might as well be mine.”
Hyshia

No one is quite sure of how a Halfling adventurer has gotten his hands onto a Druchii Repeater Crossbow, and what's even stranger, the weapon is enchanted with the White Wind of Magic. Could any of Glibfoot's braggadocious tales be actually true?
Cipher Blade

Glibfoot claims that the High Elves of Ulthuan gifted him this small magical blade as thanks for single-handedly defeating a Greenskin invasion of the Asur Homeland. In reality, it is a trinket "borrowed" from the chambers of an Elven Archmage, an enchanted letter opener with the ability to magically "open" almost anything... armour included.
Thief Tactics
The Halflings' natural skill for "borrowing" is widely known, but Glibfoot's expertise in stealth and thievery is one of the few things about him that are actually legendary.
'Scourge of Orcs & Goblins'
Whether fake or real, Glibfoot's outlandish stories about slaying scores of Greenskins do certainly inspire courage in the Halflings under him.
Larger than Life
If anything, Glibfoot knows how to tell his adventures, fictitious or else. Some of his published tales, like "Hard in Hochland", are popular all across the Empire and beyond.
A True Hero
No more theatrics, no more lies. Now is the time for honest action and real courage.
A Raunchy Tale
You know, this reminds me of the time I snuck into the court of the Witch King of the Druchii and had a tryst with Hag Queen Morathi in her own chambers, let me tell you this most salacious story...
A Grim Tale

...and there was I, fighting alongside Emperor Karl Franz, Luthor Huss, the Huntsmarshal and the Elder of the Moot himself! Together we would make a last stand against the Hordes of Chaos at Zanbaijin, the bloody arena of champions...
An Under Tale

...so I ended up there, in the dark bowels of Karak-Eight-Peaks, the Dwarfen City of Pillars, crushing filthy grobi and raki skulls with my bare hands next to mighty heroes such as fearless Gotrek, the stern King Belegar and even the legendary White Dwarf! As the Dawi say, many a Grudge was avenged that day...
A Chivalrous Tale

...and It was during one my adventures through Fair Bretonnia, that, while relieving myself in one of its beautiful ponds, the fabled Lady of the Lake appeared before me! By her side, covered in the mist of legends, was the Green Knight himself! And so they revealed my most sacred duty... to lead a holy quest into Foul Mousillon, the cursed city of undeath...
And the Adventure Continues!

...but this is not the end of my tale, my fellow Halflings! There remain many of my great adventures yet to tell; My perilous trek through exotic Lustria! My quest for the fabled Casket of Souls at the Pyramid of Doom in Ancient Nehekhara! And finally, the glorious endless feasts in the realm of Greasus Goldtooth, Overtyrant of All Ogres!
The Comradeship

The Comradeship was an elite group of heroes from all across the Empire sworn to defend the Moot and it's inhabitants. Glibfoot has made a call for all those brave enough to once again join together in defense of all Halflings against the Forces of Destruction.
Wardens of the Moot
The Mootland Wardens are as elite as it gets when it comes to Halfling warriors. Glibfoot has promised double the food they get now if they redouble their efforts in defending the Moot.
A Place in the Songs
With me now, Heroes of Mootland! Not for honour, not for wealth, but for the chance to do a good deed and earn a place in the songs!
A Good Deed, A Good Meal
At the end of the day, Glibfoot and his followers are still Halflings. And Halflings know the only true maxim of warfare; an army marches on its stomach, and Halfling stomachs really are something.
For the Moot!
“There's power in stories. That's all history is: the best tales. The ones that last. Might as well be mine.”
Hyshia

No one is quite sure of how a Halfling adventurer has gotten his hands onto a Druchii Repeater Crossbow, and what's even stranger, the weapon is enchanted with the White Wind of Magic. Could any of Glibfoot's braggadocious tales be actually true?
Cipher Blade

Glibfoot claims that the High Elves of Ulthuan gifted him this small magical blade as thanks for single-handedly defeating a Greenskin invasion of the Asur Homeland. In reality, it is a trinket "borrowed" from the chambers of an Elven Archmage, an enchanted letter opener with the ability to magically "open" almost anything... armour included.
Thief Tactics
The Halflings' natural skill for "borrowing" is widely known, but Glibfoot's expertise in stealth and thievery is one of the few things about him that are actually legendary.
Halfling of the People
Fieldwardens are esteemed figures in Halfling society, they know everyone and everyone knows them. Their sole presence can instill courage in the heart of fellow Halflings.
Friendly Competition
The presence of a Fieldwarden often leads nearby Halflings to try and outdo each other in an effort to impress the Fieldwarden.
Border Patrols
Lone Fieldwardens are often posted in the forests and hills at the borders of the Moot in order to stop any covert enemy incursions.
Defender of the Moot
And stay out, unless you want the next one to hit something more sensitive!
The Art of Cooking
A true master of his craft, the dishes of the Master Chef are so potent that they can alter the course of battle. Yes, with food, these are Haflings we're talking about.
Beef & Beer Pie
The smell of Halfling pies actually could raise the dead from the grave. Might even be why the Undead keep invading.
The Feast is Coming!
Doesn't matter if you're a Halfling, an Ogre or something else, the promise of good grub is worth fighting for.
Hot Spices
Recently imported from Lustria, these curious red thin peppers emit a pungent smell even from a good distance.
In Defense of the Moot
The Halflings of the Moot are a peaceful and pastoral people, but their bravery in defence of their homeland against Undead and Greenskin incursions should not be doubted
For All That Is Pure and Good
They have mistaken our love of peace for weakness! To battle, for the Moot!
Spill the Soup!
On a desperate situation, the Master Chef will spill a pot containing the famously explosive "Hot Pot" stew recipe on nearby enemies.... and himself.
Smallfolk Luck
Halflings seem to be preternaturally lucky and oddly resistant to even the darkest, dangerous magic.
Some Master Chefs choose to carry their kitchen onto the battlefield in a chuck wagon.
Many Halfling commanders choose to ride pigs into battle. Hey, what, stop laughing.
Many Halfling commanders choose to ride the largest Moot Cockerel specimens into battle.
Many Halfling commanders choose to ride pigs into battle. Hey, what, stop laughing.
Chuck Wagon
Battle Swine
Battle Cockerel
Battle Swine
Sovereign Grand Inspector Comrade
Incredibly brave, incredibly rich, and yet not incredibly stupid, Olorin the Grey Wizard is the most successful leader that the Comradeship has had in a long time.
Glammyding
The magical Halfling sword known as Glammyding increases its wielder's strength, while striking fear into Orcs and Goblins.
Cathay Fireworks
Olorin's special reserve of fireworks from Cathay, "borrowed" from their last diplomatic mission, whenever that was.
Bottomless Hat of Rabbit
Olorin is much admired in the Moot for hisability to pull rabbits out of his hat. Tasty rabbits, too.
Leader of Halflings
Olorin is used to dealing with the usual rag-tag bunch of Halflings the Comradeship always attracts.
Rockets' Grey Glare
Olorin's been meaning to try this for ages, and has finally gotten the time to do it: enchant his rockets with the Grey Wind of Magic.
The Grey Wanderer
All members of the Comradeship are wanderers, all looking for somewhere to go. Olorin regularly gives them that "where".
Comradeship Recruitment Drive
The Comradeship, we're always hiring.
Firework Shows
Olorin is much admired in the Moot for his fireworks displays. His enemies, however, are far less understand of his explosive obsession.
Eagle Lover
After being saved from an embarassing situation by an eagle (it's a long story) Olorin has become very fond of these great birds.
Conjurer of Tricks
Olorin knows a parlor trick or two, while usually employed to entertain Mootfolk, they might just have some uses out in the larger world.
Agent of the Grey Order
After drinking a little too much with Aragand, Olorin lets slip his secret: The Comradeship was created as a recruiting tool for the Grey Order. It's one of the ways it covertly finds apprentices.
Venerable Grand Comrade
Aragand somehow reached the rank of Venerable Grand Comrade. Not even Legles knows how or when that happened.
Aragand the Layabout's Sword
An impressive, but seemingly broken, two-handed sword. Aragand the Layabout likes to ramble on about how it only appears to be broken, and is, in fact, in mint condition.
Keigel's Natural Pig Swill
Only the worst low-life scum would ever deign to put this vile concoction to the taste. Worse, the after-effects of this vile brew are painful and accompanied with much vomiting.
Well-Travelled
Even before becoming a member of the Comradeship, Aragand has travelled the world many times over. Dwarfen beer, Norscan mead, Elvish wine, Kislevite vodka...
Patron of Taverns
Aragand is the type of bloke you see sitting in the corner of every tavern in the Empire. The cooks of the Moot are happy to have such a loyal customer and are more than eager to serve him.
Alone and Scruffy
Aragand's disheveled appearance is all a facade. His tattered cloths? Freer movement in combat. The dirt on his face? War paint used to scare his enemies. Or at least that's what he'll tell you.
Well-Drunk
...Bretonnian brandy, rotgut, Orcish bitters, kvas, samogon, koumiss, fungus beer, Zhufbar ale....
Drunken Master
When fighting under the influence, Aragand's movements are swaying and unpredictable. He says it's a technique he picked up while visiting some far eastern land.
Cold Culchan
After an ultimatum from Olorin, Aragand has decided to quit drinking. What could go wrong? What could go right?
Inspector Inquisitor Comrade
Legles has been part of the Comradeship for a long time and has seen four leaders come and go. He has been an Inspector Inquisitor Comrade for more than a hundred years, and is a little annoyed.
Friendship Bracelet
Giblit, for the sake of our friendship, please go steal from that sleeping dragon.
Ring of Concealment
The magical Ring of Concealment makes it very difficult for others to see its wearer.
Whirling Death
Bimbo's Book allows a Halfling leader to give some sage advice to his army. "Sage Advice" is Halfling for a good talking to.
Storm of Blades
What beauty and violence there is in the dance? A flurry of blades and a certain savagery of intent...
The Shadow Coils
The wending and twisting of the Wardancers hardens their spirits and their bodies against would-be attackers.
Woven Mist
The Wardancer threads and loops, contorting to create an ethereal fabric that turns aside arrows and bolts.
An Unlikely Friendship
A little encouragement goes a long way – a long way to having Legles's main source of entertainment stick around for a moment longer.
Prankster of Loec
Legles has taken it upon himself to steer Giblit into trouble whenever possible. He does this to push the failed Slayer out of comfort zone so that he may grow. It's also hilarious.
Feastmaster
As a servant of Loec, God of Revelry, Legles knows a thing or two about throwing feasts and festivals. Needless to say, he's a minor celebrity in the Moot.
Morning Constitutionals
Legles should really add a brisk walk back into his morning routine. In fact, it was on one of these morning constitutionals where he was forcibly befriended by a certain hapless dwarf.
Comrade and Brother Eternal
The rank of Comrade and Brother Eternal comes with many perks and responsibilities. Like cleaning the latrines and carrying Aragand around when he has fallen asleep.
Friendship Bracelet
This friendship bracelet represents the great task of repentance that lays before Giblit, being friends with an elf for the rest of his life.
Bimbo's Book of Sage Advice
Bimbo's Book allows a Halfling leader to give some sage advice to his army. "Sage Advice" is Halfling for a good talking to.
Self Preservation
Giblit would very much like to see tomorrow.
Gluttonous
Slayers suffer bouts of depression, and failed slayers doubly so. This often leads to periods when they glut themselves on alcohol or food.
Dragon Friend
It was fleeing from a dragon that made him broke his oath, all those years ago. In a very un-dwarfy manner, he holds no grudge, and is now quite fond of the beasts.
Slayer Memories
Giblit, for a time, was an experienced Slayer. While a different dwarf now, he still has those memories of past deeds, slaying trolls, giants, and even daemons.
Honorary Halfling
Even halflings sometimes mistake Giblit as one of their own, given his short stature, gentle disposition, and love of food.
Renewed Oath
While Giblit is unable (and unwilling) to take the Slayer Oath again, he is ready to make an oath that he will protect his friends in the Moot and the Comradeship.
40 Goulashes

It is said that the Hearth of Esmeralda holds an eternal vessel, inside of which a stew has cooked since time immemorial. Those who fall inside the pot will eventually lose themselves to an empyrean piquancy and a transmundane mouthfeel.
Phineas's Wrath
Call upon a manifestation of Phineas Fullpouch, patron of tobacco smokers, to huff and puff your enemies away!
Whiff of Home and Hearth
So far behind, and yet how easily the memories and smells of home spring to mind.
Josias's Bodily Cleanse
Josias the Farmer can provide five of the seven recommended servings of fruits and vegetables. Not locally sourced, but certainly locally applied.
Barnyard Stampede

A simultaneous prayer to both Gaffey the Builder and Josias the Farmer can result in the appearance of a dimensional barndoor, likely linked to a stable somewhere in the Aver March, where husbandry is an art.
Esmeralda's Last Course
Pies can be thought of as a divine manifestation of Esmeralda. Any foe of the Moot that finds themself baked inside one won't last long, one way or the other...
Haffenlyver
Quinsberry, the halfling god of ancestry and tradition, grants each ally a tailor-made vision of their lineage, bolstering their resolve in combat.
Praise Esmeralda
The most popular Halfling deity, Esmerelda, the Many-Times-Grandmother, is the goddess of hearth and home.
Appease Phineas
Phineas is the god of smoking and tobacco. He is worshipped by smokers and known for his ever-full pouch of smoking herbs
Honor Joasias

Josias the Faithful is the Halfling god of agriculture, animal husbandry, and tobacco. He is worshipped by farmers, herdsmen, and gardeners of The Moot. Offerings to Josias include crops and food, in particular thick soups. Among Haflings Josias is known for working hard and resting hard.
Placate Groplotta

Groplotta is the goddess of herbalism and nature. Herbalists who revere Groplotta believe modern farming techniques destroy the natural course of the woods and hills. Needless to say, they don't send too many offerings Josias's way.
Celebrate Hyacinth

Hyacinth is the Halfling god of fertility, sex, and childbirth. Boiled water and palliative herbs are offerings to Hyacinth. Midwives, pregnant women, and revellers particularly venerate this deity, who is notably fond of twins and triplets.
Admire Gaffey
Gaffey is the god of building and villages. He is primarily worshipped by builders and village elders.
Hail Quinsberry

Quinsberry is the Halfling god of knowledge, ancestry, and tradition. His two main symbols are a ram's head and a bunch of grapes, both of which symbolise a sense of lineage and paternity amongst Halflings. Offerings to Quinsberry include books, tapestry, and gold.
